com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation

Class LongOperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.core.notifications.NotifierImpl
      • com.samysadi.acs.core.tracing.ProbedImpl
        • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.EntityImpl
          • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.RunnableEntityImpl
            • com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation.OperationImpl<Resource>
              • com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation.LongOperationImpl<Resource>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity, RunnableEntity, Notifier, Probed, LongOperation<Resource>, Operation<Resource>, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SynchronizableLongOperationImpl, TimerOperation

    public abstract class LongOperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>
extends OperationImpl<Resource>
implements LongOperation<Resource>
    This is the default implementation of the LongOperation interface.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • LongOperationImpl

        public LongOperationImpl()
        Empty constructor that creates a zero-length operation.

        This constructor is provided only to satisfy the Entity contract. You should use LongOperationImpl(long) though.

      • LongOperationImpl

        public LongOperationImpl(long operationLength)
        Parameters:
        operationLength - a long value indicating the length of this operation, needs to be strictly positive

      • getLength

      • getResourceMax

        public long getResourceMax()
        Description copied from interface: LongOperation
        Returns the maximum resource value that this operation can use (inclusive).

        Default value is Long.MAX_VALUE.

        For resources that needs a unit of time (to represent bandwidth, transfer rates, computation speed etc..), the value returned here is assumed to be the maximum length that can be processed in one Simulator.SECOND.

        Specified by:
        getResourceMax in interface LongOperation<Resource extends LongResource>
        Returns:
        the maximum resource value that this operation can use (inclusive)

      • setResourceMax

        public void setResourceMax(long resourceMax)
        Description copied from interface: LongOperation
        Sets the maximum resource value that this operation can use (inclusive).

        For resources that needs a unit of time (to represent bandwidth, transfer rates, computation speed etc..), the value set here is assumed to be the maximum length that can be processed in one Simulator.SECOND.

        Specified by:
        setResourceMax in interface LongOperation<Resource extends LongResource>

      • getResourceMin

        public long getResourceMin()
        Description copied from interface: LongOperation
        Returns the minimum resource value that is needed by this operation to start (inclusive).

        When starting the operation, if this operation receives a smaller promise than this value from its provisioner, then it fails.

        Default value is 1l.

        For resources that needs a unit of time (to represent bandwidth, transfer rates, computation speed etc..), the value returned here is assumed to be the minimum length that can be processed in one Simulator.SECOND.

        Specified by:
        getResourceMin in interface LongOperation<Resource extends LongResource>
        Returns:
        the minimum resource value that is needed by this operation to start (inclusive).

      • setResourceMin

        public void setResourceMin(long resourceMin)
        Description copied from interface: LongOperation
        Sets the minimum resource value needed by the operation to start (inclusive).

        For resources that needs a unit of time (to represent bandwidth, transfer rates, computation speed etc..), the value set here is assumed to be the minimum length that can be processed in one Simulator.SECOND.

        Specified by:
        setResourceMin in interface LongOperation<Resource extends LongResource>

      • getCompletedLength

        public long getCompletedLength()
        Description copied from interface: LongOperation
        Returns the total length that was processed by the operation.

        If the operation is running, then this does not include the length that was processed since the operation was started. Only the length that has been processed during previous runs is included.

        Specified by:
        getCompletedLength in interface LongOperation<Resource extends LongResource>
        Returns:
        the total length that was processed by the operation

      • getRemainingDelay

        public final long getRemainingDelay()
        Description copied from interface: Operation
        Returns the delay remaining until the end of this operation using the current allocated resources, or -1l if the operation will not end.

        If the operation is running, the returned value takes into account the progress made since it was started.

        The -1l return value indicates that there is an infinite remaining delay for the operation to complete. This is for instance the case if the operation has zero allocated resources, or if the operation is delayed (see Operation.isDelayed()).

        Specified by:
        getRemainingDelay in interface Operation<Resource extends LongResource>
        Returns:
        the delay remaining until the end of this operation using the current allocated resources or -1l if the operation will not end

      • isDelayed

        public boolean isDelayed()
        Description copied from interface: Operation
        Returns true if the operation is running and is delayed.

        If an operation is delayed, then it will keep running forever and will never complete. You have to pause and restart the operation so that it can complete.

        It is left to implementations to decide if and when to delay an operation.

        Specified by:
        isDelayed in interface Operation<Resource extends LongResource>
        Returns:
        true if the operation is running and is delayed.

      • isDelayedBeforeCompletion

        public boolean isDelayedBeforeCompletion()
        Description copied from interface: Operation
        Returns true if the operation is delayed, or if it will be delayed at a certain moment before completion.

        When this method returns true, then some time before completion, this operation will release any used resources and will enter in a never-ending running state.

        When current operation is not running, then this method returns true if, after being started, the operation will be delayed before completion.

        Specified by:
        isDelayedBeforeCompletion in interface Operation<Resource extends LongResource>
        Returns:
        true if the operation is delayed or if it will be delayed at a certain moment before completion.

      • doStart

        public void doStart()
        Description copied from class: OperationImpl
        Activate the current operation. These basic steps are taken:
        • Allocates the wanted resource on each Provisioner that is related to this operation;
        • Updates this operation state and schedules an event for the end of operation to automatically deactivate it when it is completed.
        The new operation state is set to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.RUNNING if successful or to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.FAILED if the operation cannot be activated (example: not enough resources).
        Specified by:
        doStart in interface RunnableEntity
        Specified by:
        doStart in class OperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>

      • doPause

        public void doPause()
        Description copied from class: OperationImpl
        Pauses the current operation. These basic steps are taken:
        • Frees the allocated resource on each Provisioner that is related to this operation;
        • Updates this operation state and discards any scheduled event during operation activation;
        • Updates total completed length, and sets the operation state to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.COMPLETED if needed.
        The new Operation state is set to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.PAUSED or to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.COMPLETED.

        Specified by:
        doPause in interface RunnableEntity
        Specified by:
        doPause in class OperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>

      • doRestart

        public void doRestart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Reinitializes the entity and restarts it from the beginning.

        Use this method to start again an entity after it is terminated. So, unlike RunnableEntity.doStart() this method will not throw an exception if this entity is already terminated.

        Make sure that RunnableEntity.canRestart() returns true before calling this method or you will get an exception.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must be canceled.

        Specified by:
        doRestart in interface RunnableEntity
        Specified by:
        doRestart in class OperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>

      • doTerminate

        public void doTerminate()
        Description copied from class: OperationImpl
        Will pause the operation and cancel it if it is not completed.
        Specified by:
        doTerminate in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:
        doTerminate in class OperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>
